nodes.description: 2016年1月15日，Al-Shabaab分子在肯尼亚El Adde军事基地发动自杀式爆炸和大规模袭击，导致肯尼亚士兵死亡
nodes.support_text: On January 15, a massive blast shattered the dawn calm at El Adde military base. A suicide bomber had detonated a truck loaded with explosives...

nodes.description: 袭击持续整天，约300名Al-Shabaab分子使用AK-47、火箭筒等武器对驻军发动密集攻击
nodes.support_text: The raid lasted the entire day; thousands upon thousands of bullets fired by some 300 Al-Shabaab militants in a brutal assault...

nodes.description: 肯尼亚政府最初称士兵在协助反恐行动，后承认141名士兵死亡，但未举行全国哀悼
nodes.support_text: By the time the sun set, as many as 141 Kenyan soldiers were dead ... Kenya's government is yet to release official figures.

nodes.description: Al-Shabaab发布48分钟宣传视频，展示袭击过程并指控肯尼亚政府隐瞒真相
nodes.support_text: Al-Shabaab released a flashy, high-definition video three months after the attack. It shows tracer rounds lighting up the sky as a massive firefight for the base begins...

nodes.description: 肯尼亚军方开始秘密归还士兵遗体，部分家属通过DNA检测确认身份
nodes.support_text: More coffins, more bodies have been quietly handed over, one by one, to the soldiers' grieving families ... Corporal James Saitoti Kuronoi's remains were subjected to seven DNA tests...

nodes.description: 政府以国家安全为由引用法律，逮捕试图传播袭击影像的博主
nodes.support_text: One local blogger who tweeted a photograph showing of the aftermath of the attack was promptly arrested.

nodes.description: 分析人士批评政府透明度不足，导致Al-Shabaab的恐怖叙事占据主导
nodes.support_text: Analysts say the KDF's lack of transparency has only provided more fodder for Al-Shabaab's ideological battle.

nodes.description: 肯尼亚总统Uhuru Kenyatta仅向4名确认死亡士兵家属致哀，未公布完整伤亡名单
nodes.support_text: Uhuru Kenyatta paid tribute to the four acknowledged casualties ... but no official information released by the government.

edges.support_text: The raid lasted the entire day; thousands upon thousands of bullets fired by some 300 Al-Shabaab militants in a brutal assault...
By the time the sun set, as many as 141 Kenyan soldiers were dead -- some shot at point-blank range.
The only clues to what happened at El Adde -- and just how many Kenyan troops died there -- remains shrouded in mystery.
More coffins, more bodies have been quietly handed over, one by one, to the soldiers' grieving families...
Kenyan President Uhuru Kenyatta paid tribute to the four acknowledged casualties from the raid as they were brought home.
One local blogger who tweeted a photograph showing of the aftermath of the attack was promptly arrested.
Information surrounding the attack needed to be handled 'carefully' and 'meticulously,' Cabinet Secretary for Defense Rachael Omamo explained...
